headline: How can mobile app developers take credit for their work?
description:
I've spent the past year building a (complex) mobile app for a client and we've released it to Play Store. Currently, none of my branding is on the app. When people find the app, there is no connection to me, the Developer of the app.

As a freelancer, I want to be able to put this app in my portfolio to attract future prospects.

How do app developers usually take credit for their work? Websites usually credit the creator at the footnote at the bottom, but I don't see any such etiquette in mobile apps.

Is there an obvious/subtle solution?
description_zh-Hans: 在过去的一年里，我为一个客户建立了一个（复杂的）移动应用程序，我们已经将其发布到Play Store。目前，我的品牌形象没有出现在该应用程序上。当人们找到这个应用程序时，与我这个应用程序的开发者没有任何联系。 [...]
description_zh-Hant: 在過去的一年裡，我為一個客戶建立了一個（複雜的）移動應用程序，我們已經將其發佈到Play Store。目前，我的品牌形象沒有出現在該應用程序上。當人們找到這個應用程序時，與我這個應用程序的開發者沒有任何聯繫。 [...]
